channel.title: Best source for learning
channel.description:
Hello everyone,
Well, I haven't been on here since 2010. And even then I really was basically just a leech. (The first step to solving a problem is admitting it!) And now I've come back with the goal of actually learning. I just wanted to get the opinions of some people in the community on which source to use and what deob (if I remember the terminology correctly...) to use. Preferably a source and deob that will have plenty of tutorials so I can learn. Remember, this isn't an attempt at making a successful server for now (so if 317's aren't popular servers, it doesn't matter, it won't be hosted), it's an attempt at learning and understanding and then possibly in the future making one. Thanks everyone! Looking forward to the responses!

item.title: Best source for learning
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

None, i know i’m not good at rsps but theres only 3 things you need for rsps.
To know Java, the ints and code already in the base + layout helps and how to use your java knowledge.
Thats just what I can tell, I know some Java cause I’m doing it at college but I’m crap at rsps tbh and thats why I think I am but hey i may be wrong.
But I guess the most basic one would be best in a sense assuming it had been coded well so by that logic I’d say hyperion but I’ve never read over hyperion personally so I can’t reccomend it.

Read full topic

item.title: Best source for learning
item.dc:creator: @Fridder Fridder
item.description:
@Fridder wrote:

I learned from Allstar, then eventually moved to PI.

Read full topic
